data.title: ALISON EDMOND
data.meta_description: Portfolio of Alison Edmond, one of the most highly regarded fashion stylists in the fashion industry: Creative & Fashion Director of Harper's Bazaar UK 1997 - 2010, previously 5 years as West Coast Editor of Harper's Bazaar US, and 6 years at Vogue UK.  Fashion Editor at Large for Marie Claire US since 2010, Los Angeles Ambassador for The British Fashion Council, Contributing Fashion Editor Elle UK
data.text:
Alison Edmond is a longtime editorial creative director with over 25 years experience, based in Los Angeles, overseeing concept, photo and art direction, styling, and content production for magazines, advertising, marketing campaigns across the entertainment, fashion, and music industries, plus custom styling for a select clientele.

She is currently Artistic & Fashion Director at The Hollywood Reporter, and Head of Creative for online media site Mr Feelgood. In addition, she is an Ambassador for British Fashion in Los Angeles for The British Fashion Council, and a Trustee to the Bazaar Arts / Fashion Fund.

Alison grew up in the North East of England and began her career when hired by Anna Wintour as Art Coordinator of British Vogue. She moved into the fashion department under the editorship of Elizabeth Tilberis and went from assisting to become Mens Fashion Editor. When Liz Tilberis moved to US Harper's Bazaar, Alison followed as West Coast Editor for the next five years. Upon her return to London, she was appointed Creative & Fashion Director of Harper’s Bazaar UK, where she subsequently oversaw the creative direction of over one hundred covers and numerous fashion shoots during her 12 year tenure.

She left Bazaar UK to return to Los Angeles when approached by Marie Claire US editor Joanna Coles, and was hired by Nina Garcia as Fashion Editor at Large. Alison continued to work as a contributing editor to Hearst Magazines for ten years, in addition to working with many other publications.
